answers.author: R. Churchill
answers.text:
The Recovery Act reporting requirements have accentuated positive intergovernmental cooperation.  We an existing relationship with a regional planning agency that has grown more intense with the reporting requirements.  It has been that agency and the City of Tracy's mutual best interests to cooperate, and seek solutions where necessary.
However, this positive trend is somewhat mitigated by the overall economic downturn, and fiscal stress.  This stress sometimes creates conflicts over administrative charges, and project oversight.  There can be a small line between cooperation and competition.

answers.author: Elizabeth Kellar
answers.text:
Local and state government representatives told the General Accounting Office that the ARRA prompted more communication between our national associations and that it gave us an opportunity to become more familiar with the expertise that each goup has.  State officials said that the ARRA helped to create an enterprise approach to technology investments and applications.  This may be one of the ongoing benefits of the ARRA.  None of us could say whether or not the ARRA had enhanced state-local relationships, though we agreed that it strengthened regional cooperation.

author: Ali Miller Richards
text:
Based on your community's experience, has the Recovery Act recipient reporting exercise had any impact on intergovernmental cooperation?
ICMA staff appreciates your feedback, which we will aggregate and provide to GAO in an upcoming conference call on intergovernmental coordination as it relates to Recovery Act implementation.
title: Has Recovery Act recipient reporting had any impact on intergovernmental cooperation?
